Consider another scenario where someone has shot a police officer on a country road and left them to die.  You come across the scene and load up the victim and rush them to hospital.  You are speeding, but you have a reason and a mitigation.    Most non-law people think the second scenario is better.  You’re a hero, you’re doing the right thing, you’re helping the very group who might oppose you speeding.  You have the best possible mitigating circumstances.
